segment.source: Xperf Profile Overview
segment.target: Xperf Profile Overview

segment.source: Xperf Profile Overview
segment.target: Xperf Profile Overview

segment.source: Xperf Profile Overview
segment.target: Xperf Profile Overview

segment.source: A trace profile is a collection of settings about a specific type of trace.
segment.target: A trace profile is a collection of settings about a specific type of trace.

segment.source: These profiles are not compatible for recording with Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).
segment.target: These profiles are not compatible for recording with Windows Performance Recorder (WPR).

segment.source: You can gather and control these settings with a single command per operation.
segment.target: You can gather and control these settings with a single command per operation.

segment.source: Most profiles are one of these two types: memory-based or file-based.
segment.target: Most profiles are one of these two types: memory-based or file-based.

segment.source: Select the profile that matches the mechanism that you use for tracing: writing to a buffer in memory or writing to a file.
segment.target: Select the profile that matches the mechanism that you use for tracing: writing to a buffer in memory or writing to a file.

segment.source: The following table describes the types of sessions.
segment.target: The following table describes the types of sessions.

segment.source: Session Type
segment.target: Session Type

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: InSequentialFile sessions
segment.target: InSequentialFile sessions

segment.source: These sessions are saved into a file sequentially, extending it until a preset maximum file size is reached.
segment.target: These sessions are saved into a file sequentially, extending it until a preset maximum file size is reached.

segment.source: This behavior maps to the ETW sequential mode.
segment.target: This behavior maps to the ETW sequential mode.

segment.source: InBuffer sessions
segment.target: InBuffer sessions

segment.source: These sessions save data in memory, overwriting the oldest data with the most recent data when the buffer is full.
segment.target: These sessions save data in memory, overwriting the oldest data with the most recent data when the buffer is full.

segment.source: These sessions must be saved to a snapshot file for analysis.
segment.target: These sessions must be saved to a snapshot file for analysis.

segment.source: This behavior maps to the ETW buffering mode.
segment.target: This behavior maps to the ETW buffering mode.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The file modes cannot be combined.
segment.target: The file modes cannot be combined.
